Counts the number of objective function: Stop if the solver reaches this value.
Counts the number of restarts internal to the solver.
Stop if the solver reaches this value.
Counts the number of pivot steps during the walk.
Example: P.lop.main ../xBenchm/lop/tiny/i-5-book.lop  -seedInit 12
Example: P.lop.main
A follow-up coordinate on coordInit, associated with valueBest.
If NA, a random permutation coordinate is generated internally
as a string of size nDim — unless initial coordinate is entered by the user.
A coordinate assigned from either coordInit or coordBest.
Represents the coordinate in a Hasse graph with the rank of 0.
A coordinate type: B for binary, P for permutation, T for ternary, etc.
Represents the density of the instance matrix: non-zero-items/(nDim*nDim)
Also the name of the project directory, e.g. P.lop, P2A.cryptp, etc.
aV aStruc aHashTmp aHashNeighb aHashWalk aWalk aWalkProbed aWalkBest aValueBest aAdjacent
A string of contiguous non-space characters derived from solver environment.
Required command-line value: this can be a single integer, a string of
contiguous non-space characters, or a relative/absolute filePath.
A string of contiguous non-space characters derived from instanceDef.
If solver returns FALSE, runtime and other results are being censored.
If asserted, only the procedure *.init is invoked, solver exits afterwards.
If asserted, results are generated in bash by command P.lopP, P=python.
If asserted, simpler-to-code but less efficient procedures are invoked.
If asserted, results are generated in bash by command P.lopT, T=tcl.
The effective size of coordinate related to instanceDef.
By default, neighbDist = 1 probes the pivot neighborhood at
distance of 1 only -- the maximum distance <= nDim*(nDim-1)/2.
Size of the neighborhood around current pivot:
if neighbDist = 1, then neighbSize = nDim - 1.
If asserted, the self-avoiding walk principles are disabled.
If asserted, results are not reported to stdout.
The rank of initial coordinate wrt coordRef.
Measures the solver runtime in seconds.
Stop if the solver runtime exceeds these many seconds.
Runtime seconds of reading the instance file.
If NA, a random positive integer is created to initialize a
random number generator.
Also the name of the project directory, e.g. P.lop, P2A.cryptp, etc.
A string of contiguous non-space characters derived from solver parameters.
The relative path of the file that contains procedure *main.
A string of contiguous non-space characters, such as sa, ant, bee, etc.
is taken as the GMT date of the file that contains *main, e.g. 20150309155208.
Unless the variable aV(solverVersion) is specified under *main, a 14-digit value
If solver returns TRUE, objective function target value has been reached.
A 14-digit value — the GMT date of solver invocation, e.g. 20150310163212.
A value returned by objective function, given coordBest.
A value returned by objective function, given coordInit.
A value assigned from either valueInit or valueBest.
Objective function target value -- solver stops on reaching this value.
A coefficient to adjust valueTarget = valueTarget*(1 + valueTol).
An integer list 1, 2, 3, …, nDim, initially in the natural order.
A coefficient that determines walkIntervalLmt as walkIntervalCoef*nDim.
Inactive unless assigned an integer or if walkIntervalCoef
is assigned a real value.
An alias of cntStep which counts the number of pivot steps during the walk.
Stop if the solver reaches this value.
Inactive unless assigned an integer. If an integer, the walk is
monitored for repeats of valueBest. If walkRepeats > walkRepeatsLmt,
the self-avoiding walk branches from another coordinate with valueBest.
A coefficient that determines walkSegmLmt as walkSegmCoef*nDim.
Inactive unless assigned an integer or if walkSegmCoef is assigned a real value.
An integer variable to control levels of stdout:
If 0, do stdout with minimum lines of text.
If 1, do stdout of all variable values initialized under procedure *.init.
If 2, do stdout of cntRestart trace.
If 3, do stdout of distance=1 neighborhood probing and pivot selection.
If 4, do stdout of valueBest-only during the walk.
If 5, do stdout of up/down values during the walk.
If 6, do stdout of up/down values during the walk that includes all
'probed neighborhood values' at each step.
